ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 60
ygData.msgSnippet: ... agfainst ... And you still don t understand.  EQ was not designed for solo play. Eventually every class will have to group to be effective.  Some classes
ygData.messageBody:
>Message: 20
> Date: Fri, 11 Jun 1999 09:48:25 -0700
> From: "Obergfell, Steven" <SObergfell@...>
>Subject: Re: Warriors vs Wizards
>
>You ignore the main difference between the two, one can only strike
agfainst
>a single opponent, while the other works against groups of opponents. Oh,
>and yes, I have a very good clue about game balance. Right now, it is out
>of balance, otherwise we would have warriors being able to solo just as
>easily as Mages, Necros, Rangers and the like.


And you still don't understand. EQ was not designed for solo play.
Eventually every class will have to group to be effective. Some classes
like the warrior end up not being able to solo at an earlier level.

Don't argue for enhanced solo capabilities. Brad wanted a game where people
benefited from working together. He wanted to make solo play hard, if not
impossible, especially at higher levels.


Wayne
